KOZHIKODE

Kozhikode, also known as Calicut, is a district in the south-western part of Kerala that has a lot to offer for tourists. It is a place where you can enjoy the natural beauty, the historical heritage, and the cultural diversity of Kerala. Here are some of the tourist attractions in Kozhikode district that you can visit:

Kozhikode Beach: This is one of the most popular beaches in Kerala, with golden sand, clear water, and coconut palms. You can sunbathe, swim, surf, or indulge in some adventure sports at this beach, or simply enjoy the sunset and the sea breeze. The beach also has a sculpture garden, a children’s park, and a war memorial nearby. The beach is also the venue for the annual sand art festival, which showcases the creativity and talent of the sand artists

Beypore: This is a coastal town and a major port in Kozhikode district, famous for its shipbuilding industry and fishing harbor. You can visit the Beypore Beach, which is a long and narrow stretch of sand, ideal for walking and relaxing. You can also visit the Beypore Fort, which is a historical fort built by Tipu Sultan, and the Beypore Lighthouse, which offers a panoramic view of the sea and the town. You can also witness the traditional art of making wooden ships, called uru, at the Beypore Shipyard

Thusharagiri Waterfall: This is a scenic and serene waterfall located in the Western Ghats of Kozhikode district. It cascades down as three waterfalls, named Erattumukku, Mazhavil Chattom, and Thumbithullum Para. The name of the waterfall means “snow-covered mountains”, as the water droplets create a misty effect. The waterfall is surrounded by dense forest and has a variety of flora and fauna. You can trek, camp, or visit the wildlife sanctuaries and national parks in the vicinity of the waterfall

Kadalundi Bird Sanctuary: This is a haven for birdwatchers and nature enthusiasts, situated on a cluster of islands on the confluence of the Kadalundipuzha River and the Arabian Sea. It is home to over a hundred species of native birds and around 60 species of migratory birds. It also has a mangrove forest and a scenic beach. You can spot birds such as seagulls, terns, sandpipers, herons, egrets, and flamingos at this sanctuary
